intro: Ophrys picta f. montserratensis, commonly known as the Montserrat bee orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to the island of Montserrat in the Caribbean. It is characterized by its unique floral morphology, featuring a bee-like labellum that mimics the appearance and scent of a female bee to attract male bees for pollination. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically growing on rocky soils in coastal areas. Its flowers are typically pale green with intricate markings, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat destruction and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
